title: So, I just played Zyra mid against a Yasuo.
body:
... And I make him ragequit.

I'm sorry. This is terrible, and click baity, I know, but Dear God... that was one of the most cathartic games of League of Legends I've ever played.  Yeah, Yasuo did lots of damage despite starting cull (A farming up item?) Yeah, he survived in lane by his bullshit shield, crit lifesteal sustain, and windwall blocking my spells (and not skill), and yeah I had to manage my mana while he got free sustain/shields/dashes/waveclear.

 But I still somehow managed to killed that busted ass champion three times! AND make him ragequit.

Okay, but I have a serious point here. I've played Zyra versus Yasuo several times before. This Yasuo was NOT good. He hit me with literally 2 or 3 tornadoes the entire game, while other Yasuos I've played against have hit me 2 or 3 times per every time we both come back to lane. And I STILL beat those Yasuos. But with the broken crit mastery... I don't even remember how it even works entirely. But he gained SO much free sustain after getting his first item. I'm not exaggerating but I brought him to like 50% health for him to have 90% after clearing the next wave.

My final point is this: the Yasuo I was up against was terrible but managed to survive because of just HOW busted Yasuo  is. Before preseason I beat Yasuo's who were _easily_ better. The crit keystone needs nerfed, at the LEAST.

I mean that's clearly designed to be different, and  it takes a long time to be effective. Since you gain the health slowly, it's not very effective in lane- it's basically just a small heal (albeit one with interactions with %hp dmg) for laning purposes. It's not until you have killed/been near a decent number of large minion/monster deaths and have recalled (healing back up for that bonus max HP you got) that it becomes more useful than a simple heal.

My point is that it's heavily gated, capped at a certain benefit, and isn't especially useful early in the game. So while it's true that it doesn't "activate" only against champions, that really isn't relevant in regards to its overall power.

-Periodically spawns a shield that scales with his level
-Has a ranged AoE knockup that for some reason still does damage

He's inherently squishy with his base stats but a good Yasuo will abuse his absolutely insane amount of self peel. His weakness should be that's he's squishy but most of his kit works around that giving him the mobility, shields, and crowd control he needs to negate his squishyness in duels or in teamfights. No champion should be resourceless. Be it cost them health, or some gating mechanic which inhibits their power until a condition is met. 
{{champion:92}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:55}} all have this weird spot where they don't have to have the skill set to manage resources or time their engagements to align with a condition like let's say {{champion:150}} or {{champion:68}}. As a result they are almost impossible to balance, because either they are to strong and demolish in lane, or they are to weak and can't make a meaningful impact outside of lane.

I know Riven was on the chopping block for this terrible design, she was going to get "edge" as a limiter which was gain when shit landed a hit with her passive and consumed when she ulted. Although apparently they decided to delay or removed the change. -_-
